item.title: About Eric Peña
item.description: Photo Credit: Samuel Sung About Me EMAIL: eric.pena@binghamton.edu Completed M.S. in Complex Systems Science as a Clifford D. Clark Diversity Fellow at the State University of New York at Binghamton and studied machine learning and complex systems modeling. Talks, Publications, and Posters Artificial Life Journal (publication) Life Worth Mentioning: Complexity of Life-Like Cellular Automata Conference on Complex Systems 2021 (talk) Life Worth Mentioning Norteast Regional Conference on Complex Systems 2021 (talk) Complexity in Conway’s Game of Life and other Life-Like Cellular Automata (poster) Bayesian Sparse Network Reconstruction Norteast Regional Conference on Complex Systems 2020 (poster) Cellular Automata Optimization using Genetic Algorithms Experience Data Scientist, Motional Statistics and Probability Teacher, SUNY Binghamton Revenue Management Senior Data Analyst, Diageo Math and Physics Tutor, Self-Employed Engineer, H.
